Class GameView

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
view.gamePanelViews.GameView
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible
public class GameView extends JPanel
view, this is the components that requests each view's draw() method. it is composed by all the game views, and decides when to display the result screen. it also helps to draw the appropriate background image, player hud such as the fps and the information of the player's current position in the game world layouy defined in LevelManager.
See Also:

  • Field Details

    • player

      private final Player player
      reference to the Player model, used to get the player's extraction status so that the ResultScreenView can appear accordingly and the interaction prompt to appear when the player is near an interactable object.

    • levelManager

      private final LevelManager levelManager
      reference to the LevelManager model, used to get the data of the current depth, level, and room type.

    • playerView

      private final PlayerView playerView
      reference to the PlayerView, used to render the player

    • interactableObjectsView

      private final InteractableObjectsView interactableObjectsView
      reference to the InteractableObjectsView, use to render all the interactable objects in the room

    • inventoryView

      private final InventoryView inventoryView
      reference to the InventoryView, used to render the player's inventory

    • enemyView

      private final EnemyView enemyView
      reference to the EnemyView, used to render all the enemies in the current room

    • resultScreenView

      private ResultScreenView resultScreenView
      reference to the ResultScreenView, used to render the result screen when the player extracts.

    • levelView

      private final LevelView levelView
      reference to the LevelView, used to render the tiles in the game.

    • window

      private final JFrame window
      reference to the JFrame window created in Main

    • backgroundImage

      private static BufferedImage backgroundImage
      background image of the game. it only gets rendered when the player is on the first layer of the world layout defined in LevelManager

    • frameCount

      private int frameCount
      numbers of frames that have passed.

    • lastFpsTime

      private long lastFpsTime
      used to track the fps.

    • fps

      private double fps
      the total frames / second text. it is used the paintComponent(Graphics) method to track the fps on the top left corner

    • fpsFont

      private final Font fpsFont
      font used to display the fps on the top left corner

    • gameFont

      public final Font gameFont
      font used to display the game text, such as the top right's world info and the interaction prompt of the player.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameView

      public GameView(Player player, TileManager tileManager, LevelManager levelManager, JFrame window)
      view of the game. it is composed by all the game models views, such as PlayerView, EnemyView, InteractableObjectsViews, LevelView, and requests the .draw() method of each component. note that it also contains the ResultScreenView, set in the TitleScreenController, so that it displays when the player successfully extracts. it calls each entity's draw method
      Parameters:
      player - Player model
      tileManager - TileManager model
      levelManager - LevelManager model
      window - the JFrame created in Main

  • Method Details

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent(Graphics g)
      this is where the game actually renders: calls every single view component to draw. tracks the fps and makes the ResultScreenView visible when the Player extracts. this method is called every time the GameController's game loop (the .run() method) requests a repaint().
      Overrides:
      paintComponent in class JComponent
      Parameters:
      g - the Graphics object to protect

    • loadFont

      public Font loadFont(String fontPath, float size)
      loads the font at the provided font path, with the provided size.
      Parameters:
      fontPath - path of the ttf file
      size - font size
      Returns:
      font

    • drawGameText

      private void drawGameText(Graphics2D g2d)
      draws the game text. top right: world info top left: fps player interaction prompt when near an interactable object.
      Parameters:
      g2d - swing's graphics 2d instance that allows rendering

    • loadBackgroundImage

      private void loadBackgroundImage()
      loads the background image, drawn in drawBackground(Graphics2D). the background is image is only drawn on the first layer of the game world. see LevelManager

    • drawBackground

      private void drawBackground(Graphics2D g2d)
      draws the game's background. it will display a background image if the player is on the first layer of LevelManager world layout, and a solid color when deeper into the game world.
      Parameters:
      g2d - swing's graphics 2d instance that allows rendering

    • setResultScreenView

      public void setResultScreenView(ResultScreenView resultScreenView)
      sets the result screen view. a setter is used because the result screen instance is created in TitleScreenController's .startMainGame() method.
      Parameters:
      resultScreenView - ResultScreenView view.
